# Installing

```bash
$ npm install --save quickfirebase
```

# Example

```js
const database = require("quickfirebase.ts");

const firebaseConfig = {
  apiKey: ...,
  authDomain: ...,
  databaseURL: ....,
  projectId: ...,
  storageBucket: ....,
  messagingSenderId: .....,
  appId: .....,
  measurementId: .....
};

let schema = {
  sales: 0;
}

const databaseManeger = new database(firebaseConfig, {name: "user", default: schema });
databaseManeger.setDefult("mohamed");

```

# More Examples

```js
(async() => {
    const data = await databaseManeger.findOne("mohamed");
    console.log(data.data.sales);
    data.data.sales += 10;
    data.save(); // to save the data to the database;
    delete("mohamed"); // to delete object from data
})()
```

# Tip 
```js
// you can add a new key with save()
(async() => {
  const data = await databaseManeger.findOne("mohamed");
   data.data.message = "hello";
   data.save();
  })()
```

# Menthodes 
```js
setDefult() // takes one argument 
findOne()  // takes one argument 
delete() // takes one argument 
deleteAll()
```
